newsitem.title: SPAIN: Anti-Europe demonstrators march through Madrid.
newsitem.headline: Anti-Europe demonstrators march through Madrid.

text.p: Thousands of demonstrators took to the streets of Madrid on Sunday to protest against European integration as dictated by the Maastricht Treaty.

Organisers of the Spanish anti-Maastricht movement said 10,000 protestors were protesting against the capitalist interests represented by the Maastricht Treaty, the blueprint for Europe's economic and monetary union.

"(Our objective) is to stimulate critical thought about the construction of Europe, whose burden has been placed on the shoulders of society and is causing serious economic, social and environmental inequalities," said one protester.
Protesters, brandishing banners saying "Maastricht, no", complained that the drive for economic and monetary union was polarising wealth, magnifying the North-South divide and worsening unemployment.
The protest, called by Madrid's Movement against Maastricht's Europe and Economic Globalisation, assembled supporters from 35 action groups including trade unions and agricultural groups.
EU leaders met in Dublin this weekend to discuss the details of how a single European currency will work and a new European treaty which will be approved in Amsterdam in June. REUTER
